summary: This document contains an email exchange discussing the political and regulatory implications of the LIBOR scandal, particularly focusing on the resignation of Bob Diamond from Barclays. It highlights the challenges faced by banks in rebuilding trust and the ongoing debate about universal banking in the UK. Jeffrey Epstein is mentioned in relation to the scandal and his communication with Peter Mandelson.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is mentioned as the sender of an email discussing the LIBOR scandal and expressing interest in discussing it further.

persons.name: Bob Diamond
persons.context: Diamond's resignation from Barclays is a central topic in the document, marking a significant moment in the banking crisis.

persons.name: Peter Mandelson
persons.context: Mandelson is the recipient of Epstein's email, indicating a connection to discussions about the LIBOR scandal.

persons.name: George Osborne
persons.context: Osborne's actions and responses to the LIBOR scandal are discussed, highlighting the political implications of the banking crisis.

persons.name: Ed Miliband
persons.context: Miliband's stance on banking and the moral critique of capitalism is mentioned in relation to the political fallout from the LIBOR scandal.

connections.description: Epstein reaches out to Mandelson to discuss the LIBOR scandal, indicating a personal connection.
Diamond's resignation and the LIBOR scandal are discussed in the context of Osborne's political responses.
Miliband's critique of the banking sector is linked to Diamond's controversial leadership at Barclays.

events.title: Bob Diamond Resignation
events.description: Bob Diamond resigns as Chief Executive of Barclays amid the LIBOR scandal.

events.title: Email Discussion on LIBOR Scandal
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein emails Peter Mandelson to discuss the LIBOR scandal and its implications.

keyFacts: Bob Diamond's resignation from Barclays is a pivotal moment in the LIBOR scandal.
The email exchange highlights the political ramifications of the banking crisis in the UK.
Jeffrey Epstein expresses interest in discussing the LIBOR scandal with Peter Mandelson.
The document discusses the challenges banks face in rebuilding trust post-scandal.
The political landscape is shifting with leaders like Ed Miliband using the scandal to critique capitalism.
